Triatoma incrassata.Anteocular region: Anteocular region about three times as long as postocular (1:0.
Triatoma incrassata.Eyes: Eyes in lateral view attaining or slightly surpassing level of under but not attaining level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma incrassata.First and: First and second antennal segments from yellowish brown to dark brown; first segment falling slightly short of level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma incrassata.First rostral segment: First rostral segment attaining level of apex of jugae, viz.
Triatoma incrassata.Integument: Integument sparsely granulose; pilosity short and sparse.
Triatoma incrassata.Length: Length of male 16-22 mm, of female 18-23 mm, width of pronotum of male 3.
Triatoma incrassata.Membrane: Membrane fumose, light brown, much lighter than darker portions of corium.
Triatoma incrassata.Overall color: Overall color piceous, with orange or orange-yellow markings on pronotum, pleura, corium, connexivum, and ventral surface of abdomen.
Triatoma incrassata.Posterior lobe: Posterior lobe rugose, with conspicuous dark setae on entire surface; submedian carinae evanescent posteriorly.
Triatoma incrassata.Ratio width of eye: Ratio width of eye to synthlipsis 1:2.
Triatoma incrassata.Scutellum: Scutellum dark; central portion only very slightly depressed, limited by irregular carinae; apical process shorter than main body of scutellum, setose, tapering distally, its apex deflected.
Triatoma incrassata.Setae: Setae of rostrum very short on first and most of under surface of second segment.
Triatoma incrassata.Submedian carinae: Submedian carinae extending to posterior third of hind lobe but evanescent before posterior margin.
Triatoma incrassata.Tibiae: Tibiae of first and second pair of male with small spongy fossulae, absent in female.
Triatoma incrassata.First antennal segment: First antennal segment falling short of apex of clypeus; second segment with short hairs only.
Triatoma incrassata.Fore: Fore and mid femora with 2+2 very short denticles subapically.
Triatoma incrassata.Fore and mid: Fore and mid femora with 2+2 very short denticles subapically.
Triatoma incrassata.Length of male: Length of male 16-22 mm, of female 18-23 mm, width of pronotum of male 3.
Triatoma incrassata.Pronotum: Pronotum dark, with 1+ 1 orange bands on lateral margins of posterior lobe, narrow anteriorly, becoming wider posteriorly and extending onto humeri; posterior margin of pronotum in some specimens lighter colored, as are submedian carinae and collar with anterolateral processes; in some specimens, dark areas of posterior lobe of pronotum reduced to one wide median and 1 + 1 sublateral stripes, with orange color extending as 1 + 1 wide lateral and 1+ 1 submedian spots occupying carinae and triangularly widened posteriorly, confluent behind with lateral markings.
Triatoma incrassata.Fore and mid femora: Fore and mid femora with 2+2 very short denticles subapically.
Triatoma incrassata.Femora: Femora of first and second pairs with I+ I subapical pointed denticles.
Triatoma incrassata.Pilosity: Pilosity well developed on entire body including corium.
Triatoma incrassata.Spongy fossulae: Spongy fossulae on fore and mid tibiae of males, absent in females.
